statements.statement: Users tend not to be visible during software development
Software developers have little experience accommodating accessibility needs
Accessibility does not occur to software developers
Cost prevents accessibility being built into software
Time pressure prevents accessibility being built into software
Some organizations do not prioritise accessibility
Accessibility is not considering during cybersecurity design
Software developers focus on privacy and security compliance, not accessibility
Software developers factor in vision impairments
Software developers often design for colour blindness
Software developers ensure that text can be enlarged
Software developers accommodate multiple languages
Software developers are not given accessibility directives
Businesses do not value accessibility
Quality Control focuses on assessing functionality
Quality Control focuses on assessing ease of use
Accessibility is seen as an add-on in software development
Accessibility not a consideration during software specification writing
It is difficult to test for accessibility
There are no accessibility tools for software developers to use
Software Developers build software for users like themselves
There are tools to build accessible software but adoption is low
Accessibility is related to the ease of use of software
Software Specifications should include accessibility requirements
Quality Control should check accessibility requirements
Usability testers should check accessibility requirements
Inclusivity refers to all features being implemented
Regulations should enforce accessibility requirements
Smaller organisations cannot afford software accessibility
Inclusivity and accessibility are not included in software professional education
Software developers assume users can read well
Accessibility and Inclusivity are the same thing
Awareness of the need for accessibility and inclusivity needs to come from the top
Software developers assume users have access to the Internet
Software customers seldom mandate accessibility
Software developers focus on functionality and ease of use â€“ not accessibility
